id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

broker.docs:
**string**: The host of your MQTT broker.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

port.docs:
**int**: The port to connect to. Defaults to 1883.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

username.docs:
**string**: The username to use for authentication. Empty (the default) means no authentication.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

password.docs:
**string**: The password to use for authentication. Empty (the default) means no authentication.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

client_id.docs:
**string**: The client id to use for opening connections. See [Defaults](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-defaults) for more information.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

idf_send_async.docs:
**bool**: Only with `esp-idf`. If true publishing the message happens from the internal mqtt task. The client only enqueues the message. Defaults to `false`. The advantage of asyncronous publishing is that it doesn’t block the esphome main thread. The disadvantage is a delay (up to 1-2 seconds) until the messages are actually sent out. Set this to true if you send large amounts of of data over mqtt.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

certificate_authority.docs:
**string**: Only with `esp-idf`. CA certificate in PEM format. See [TLS with esp-idf (esp32)](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-tls-idf) for more information

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

skip_cert_cn_check.docs:
**bool**: Only with `esp-idf`. Don’t verify if the common name in the server certificate matches the value of `broker`.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

discovery.docs:
**boolean**: If Home Assistant automatic discovery should be enabled. Defaults to `true`.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

discovery_retain.docs:
**boolean**: Whether to retain MQTT discovery messages so that entities are added automatically on Home Assistant restart. Defaults to `true`.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

discovery_prefix.docs:
**string**: The prefix to use for Home Assistant’s MQTT discovery. Should not contain trailing slash. Defaults to `homeassistant`.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

discovery_unique_id_generator.docs:
**string**: The unique_id generator to use. Can be one of `legacy` or `mac`. Defaults to `legacy`, which generates unique_id in format `ESP<component_type><default_object_id>`. `mac` generator uses format `<mac_address>-<component_type>-<fnv1_hash(friendly_name)>`.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

discovery_object_id_generator.docs:
**string**: The object_id generator to use. Can be one of `none` or `device_name`. Defaults to `none` which does not generate object_id. `device_name` generator uses format `<device_name>_<friendly_name>`.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

use_abbreviations.docs:
**boolean**: Whether to use [Abbreviations](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/mqtt/discovery/) in discovery messages. Defaults to `true`.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

birth_message.docs:
**[MQTTMessage](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-message)**: The message to send when a connection to the broker is established. See [Last Will And Birth Messages](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-last-will-birth) for more information.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

will_message.docs:
**[MQTTMessage](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-message)**: The message to send when the MQTT connection is dropped. See [Last Will And Birth Messages](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-last-will-birth) for more information.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

shutdown_message.docs:
**[MQTTMessage](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-message)**: The message to send when the node shuts down and the connection is closed cleanly. See [Last Will And Birth Messages](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-last-will-birth) for more information.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

topic_prefix.docs:
**string**: The prefix used for all MQTT messages. Should not contain trailing slash. Defaults to `<APP_NAME>`.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

level.docs:
**string**: The log level to use for MQTT logs. See [Log Levels](https://esphome.io/components/logger.html#logger-log-levels) for options.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

log_topic.docs:
**[MQTTMessage](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-message)**: The topic to send MQTT log messages to.The `log_topic` has an additional configuration option:
  * **level** (*Optional*, string): The log level to use for MQTT logs. See [Log Levels](https://esphome.io/components/logger.html#logger-log-levels) for options.
  
  

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

ssl_fingerprints.docs:
**list**: Only on ESP8266. A list of SHA1 hashes used for verifying SSL connections. See [SSL Fingerprints](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-ssl-fingerprints). for more information.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

keepalive.docs:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The time to keep the MQTT socket alive, decreasing this can help with overall stability due to more WiFi traffic with more pings. Defaults to 15 seconds.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

reboot_timeout.docs:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The amount of time to wait before rebooting when no MQTT connection exists. Can be disabled by setting this to `0s`. Defaults to `15min`.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

on_connect.docs:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An action to be performed when a connection to the broker is established.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

on_disconnect.docs:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An action to be performed when the connection to the broker is dropped.

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

topic.docs:
**string**: The MQTT topic to subscribe to and listen for MQTT messages on. Every time a message with **this exact topic** is received, the automation will trigger.

*See also: [on_message Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#on-message-trigger)*

qos.docs:
**int**: The MQTT Quality of Service to subscribe to the topic with. Defaults to 0.

*See also: [on_message Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#on-message-trigger)*

payload.docs:
**string**: Optionally set a payload to match. Only if exactly the payload you specify with this option is received, the automation will be executed.

*See also: [on_message Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#on-message-trigger)*

on_message.docs:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An action to be performed when a message on a specific MQTT topic is received. See [on_message Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-on-message).

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

topic.docs:
**string**: The MQTT topic to subscribe to and listen for MQTT messages on. Every time a message with **this exact topic** is received, the automation will trigger.

*See also: [on_json_message Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#on-json-message-trigger)*

qos.docs:
**int**: The MQTT Quality of Service to subscribe to the topic with. Defaults to 0.

*See also: [on_json_message Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#on-json-message-trigger)*

on_json_message.docs:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An action to be performed when a JSON message on a specific MQTT topic is received. See [on_json_message Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-on-json-message).

*See also: [MQTT Client Component](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#configuration-variables)*

topic.docs:
**string**: The MQTT topic to publish the message.

*See also: [MQTTMessage](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqttmessage)*

qos.docs:
**int**: The [Quality of Service](https://www.hivemq.com/blog/mqtt-essentials-part-6-mqtt-quality-of-service-levels) level of the topic. Defaults to 0.

*See also: [MQTTMessage](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqttmessage)*

retain.docs:
**boolean**: If the published message should have a retain flag on or not. Defaults to `true`.

*See also: [MQTTMessage](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqttmessage)*

topic.docs:
**string, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: The MQTT topic to publish the message.

*See also: [on_json_message Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-publish-action)*

qos.docs:
**int, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: The [Quality of Service](https://www.hivemq.com/blog/mqtt-essentials-part-6-mqtt-quality-of-service-levels) level of the topic. Defaults to 0.

*See also: [on_json_message Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-publish-action)*

retain.docs:
**boolean, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: If the published message should have a retain flag on or not. Defaults to `false`.

*See also: [on_json_message Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-publish-action)*

publish.docs:
Publish an MQTT message on a topic using this action in automations.

*See also: [`mqtt.publish` Action](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-publish-action)*

topic.docs:
**string, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: The MQTT topic to publish the message.

*See also: [on_json_message Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-publish-json-action)*

qos.docs:
**int**: The [Quality of Service](https://www.hivemq.com/blog/mqtt-essentials-part-6-mqtt-quality-of-service-levels) level of the topic. Defaults to 0.

*See also: [on_json_message Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-publish-json-action)*

retain.docs:
**boolean**: If the published message should have a retain flag on or not. Defaults to `false`.

*See also: [on_json_message Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-publish-json-action)*

publish_json.docs:
Publish a JSON-formatted MQTT message on a topic using this action in automations.

*See also: [`mqtt.publish_json` Action](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-publish-json-action)*

connected.docs:
This [Condition](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-condition) checks if the MQTT client is currently connected to the MQTT broker.

*See also: [`mqtt.connected` Condition](https://esphome.io/components/mqtt.html#mqtt-connected-condition)*
